text: One of the worst restaurants I ever tried. I found a hair in my plate and didn't receive my plate at the same time than the other people I was with. Had to eat alone since everyone had already finished eating when my food arrived. The server was disrespectful. Asked for more water, never got it. Ate a crappy dessert that felt like sand in my mouth. The food looks like it's from a crappy school cafeteria. Don't go there and eat a sandwich instead.

Encore une fois, sortie de groupe avec mes collègues un midi.  Après le Croq pas loin, cette fois le Chateau Grec.  Je dois avouer que mon regard est très biaisé sur les restaurants de Saint-Constant car habitant à Montréal, l'offre de restaurant est tellement différente que je ne devrais pas comparer. Pourtant, c'est difficile de ne pas le faire.  Le service est rapide, sympathique.  Le choix de plat est énorme. Poissons, viandes, pâtes, pizza, salade,... etc Le plat du jour est vraiment avantageux. Les prix sont entre 8 et 12$ environ le plat et cela comprend : soupe, dessert, café ou thé. De plus, les quantités sont vraiment grosses. Genre très bon mangeur. La plupart de mes collègues avaient commandé de la viande et le tout est accompagné de salade + riz + patates. Bien consistant.  J'ai pris le fish and chip. Le poisson était bon, pas trop gras, la friture bonne. Les frites aussi et accompagné d'une petite salade. J'ai adoré la soupe lentille-tomate et le dessert pouding chômeur.  Bon aller petite critique : je ne comprend pas ce que ce restaurant à de grec. Mais ça reste entre nous ;)

Had been hesitant to try this place for years, but I was wrong! In a town where the only decent pizza you can get is at Como's. I was pleasantly surprised. Ordered a Special Grec pizza and man was it yummy! It's basically an all dressed with bacon and onions. They cook it just right, not to over cooked. The toppings are tasty, cheese cheesy,  sauce sweet, and pepperoni greasy. If you want a change and want good pizza order from Chateau Grec. No regrets:)

I was craving for a pizza and the review below made me go with Le chateau grec instead of Como. The place is super cozy and wasn't too crowded on a Thursday night. I had the medium Chateau special and it was exactly like I was expecting. If you're craving for a thick crust pizza you should give it a try.
